Theory FactoredSystemLib

theory FactoredSystemLib
  imports Main "HOL-Library.Finite_Map"
begin 


section ‚ÄπFactored Systems Library‚Ä∫

text ‚ÄπThis section contains definitions used in the factored system theory (FactoredSystem.thy) and in 
other theories. ‚Ä∫


subsection ‚ÄπSemantics of Map Addition‚Ä∫

text ‚Äπ Most importantly, we are redefining the map addition operator (`++`) to reflect HOL4 
semantics which are left to right (ltr), rather than right-to-left as in Isabelle/HOL. 

This means that given a finite map (`M = M1 ++ M2`) and a variable `v` which is in the domain of
both `M1` and `M2`, the lookup `M v` will yield `M1 v` in HOL4 but `M2 v` in Isabelle/HOL.
This behavior can be confirmed  by looking at the definition of `fmap\_add` (`++f`, 
Finite\_Map.thy:460)---which is lifted from `map\_add` (Map.thy:24)

  @{const map_add}  (infixl "++" 100) where
    @{term "m1 ++ m2 = (Œªx. case m2 x of None ‚áí m1 x | Some y ‚áí Some y)"}
  

to finite sets---and the HOL4 definition of "FUNION` (finite\_mapScript.sml:770) which recurs
on `union\_lemma` (finite\_mapScript.sml:756)

  !\^fmap g.
     ?union.
       (FDOM union = FDOM f Union (g ` FDOM)) /\
       (!x. FAPPLY union x = if x IN FDOM f then FAPPLY f x else FAPPLY g x)
  
The ltr semantics are also reflected in [Abdulaziz et al., Definition 2, p.9].
‚Ä∫

‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE hide `Map.map\_add` to free the operator symbol `++` and redefine it to reflect HOL4 map 
addition semantics.‚Ä∫
hide_const (open) Map.map_add
no_notation Map.map_add (infixl "++" 100)
definition fmap_add_ltr :: "('a, 'b) fmap ‚áí ('a, 'b) fmap ‚áí ('a, 'b) fmap" (infixl "++" 100) where 
  "m1 ++ m2 ‚â° m2 ++‚á©f m1"  


subsection ‚ÄπStates, Actions and Problems.‚Ä∫ 

text ‚Äπ Planning problems are typically formalized by considering possible states and the effect
of actions upon these states. 

In this case we consider a world model in propositional logic: i.e. states are finite maps of 
variables (with arbitrary type 'a) to boolean values and actions are pairs of states where the first
component specifies preconditions and the second component specifies effects (postconditions) of 
applying the action to a given state. [Abdulaziz et al., Definition 2, p.9] ‚Ä∫

type_synonym ('a) state = "('a, bool) fmap" 
type_synonym ('a) action = "('a state √ó 'a state)"
type_synonym ('a) problem = "('a state √ó 'a state) set"


text ‚Äπ For a given action @{term "œÄ = (p, e)"} the action domain @{term "ùíü(œÄ)"} is the set of variables `v` where 
a value is assigned to `v` in either `p` or `e`, i.e. `p v` or `e v` are defined. [Abdulaziz et al., 
Definition 2, p.9] ‚Ä∫
definition action_dom where 
  "action_dom s1 s2 ‚â° (fmdom' s1 ‚à™ fmdom' s2)"


‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE lemma `action\_dom\_pair`

  action\_dom a = FDOM (FST a) Union ((SND a) ` FDOM)

was removed because the curried definition of `action\_dom` in the translation makes it redundant.‚Ä∫


text ‚Äπ Now, for a given problem (i.e. action set) @{term "Œ¥"}, the problem domain @{term "ùíü(Œ¥)"} is given by the
union of the action domains of all actions in @{term "Œ¥"}. [Abdulaziz et al., Definition 3, p.9]

Moreover, the set of valid states @{term "U(Œ¥)"} is given by the union over all states whose domain is equal 
to the problem domain and the set of valid action sequences (or, valid plans) is given by the 
Kleene closure of @{term "Œ¥"}, i.e. @{term "Œ¥_star = {œÄ. set(œÄ) ‚äÜ Œ¥}"}. [Abdulaziz et al., Definition 3, p.9] 
  
Ultimately, the effect of executing an action `a` on a state `s` is given by calculating the 
succeding state. In general, the succeding state is either the preceding state---if the action does
not apply to the state, i.e. if the preconditions are not met---; or, the union of the effects of
the action application and the state. [Abdulaziz et al., Definition 3, p.9]
‚Ä∫

‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE name shortened to 'prob\_dom'.‚Ä∫
‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE lambda added to convert problem pairs to arguments of 'action\_dom'.‚Ä∫
definition prob_dom where 
  "prob_dom prob ‚â° ‚ãÉ ((Œª (s1, s2). action_dom s1 s2) ` prob)"

definition valid_states where
  "valid_states prob ‚â° {s. fmdom' s = prob_dom prob}"

definition valid_plans  where 
  "valid_plans prob ‚â° {as. set as ‚äÜ prob}"

definition state_succ where
  "state_succ s a ‚â° (if fst a ‚äÜ‚á©f s then (snd a ++ s) else s)"

end

Theory ListUtils

theory ListUtils
  imports Main "HOL-Library.Sublist"
begin 

‚Äï ‚ÄπTODO assure translations
  * 'sublist' --> 'subseq'
  * list\_frag l l' --> sublist l' l (switch operands!)‚Ä∫

lemma len_ge_0: 
  fixes l
  shows "length l ‚â• 0" 
  by simp

lemma len_gt_pref_is_pref: 
  fixes l l1 l2
  assumes "(length l2 > length l1)" "(prefix l1 l)" "(prefix l2 l)"
  shows "(prefix l1 l2)"
  using assms proof (induction l2 arbitrary: l1 l)
  case Nil
  then have "¬¨(length [] > length l1)"
    by simp
  then show ?case 
    using Nil
    by blast
next
  case (Cons a l2)
  then show ?case proof(induction l1 arbitrary: l)
    case Nil
    then show ?case 
      using Nil_prefix
      by blast
  next
    case (Cons b l1)
    then show ?case proof(cases l)
      case Nil
      then have "¬¨(prefix (a # l2) l)"
        by simp
      then show ?thesis using Cons.prems(4)
        by simp
    next
      case (Cons c l)
      then have 1: "length l2 > length l1" 
        using Cons.prems(2)
        by fastforce
      then show ?thesis using Cons proof(cases l)
        case Nil
        then have "l1 = [c]" "l2 = [c]" 
          using Cons.prems(3, 4) local.Cons 1 
          by fastforce+
        then show ?thesis 
          using 1 
          by auto
      next
        case (Cons d l')
        {
          thm len_ge_0
          have "length l1 ‚â• 0" 
            by simp
          then have "length l2 > 0" 
            using 1 
            by force
          then have "l2 ‚â† []" using 1
            by blast
        }
        then have "length (a # l1) ‚â§ length (b # l2)"
          using 1 le_eq_less_or_eq
          by simp
        then show ?thesis
          using Cons.prems(3, 4) prefix_length_prefix 
          by fastforce
      qed
    qed 
  qed
qed

lemma nempty_list_append_length_add: 
  fixes l1 l2 l3
  assumes "l2 ‚â† []"
  shows "length (l1 @ l3) < length (l1 @ l2 @l3)"
  using assms
  by (induction l2) auto


lemma append_filter: 
  fixes f1 :: "'a ‚áí bool" and f2 as1 as2 and p :: "'a list"
  assumes "(as1 @ as2 = filter f1 (map f2 p))"
  shows "(‚àÉp_1 p_2. 
    (p_1 @ p_2 = p) 
    ‚àß (as1 = filter f1 (map f2 p_1)) 
    ‚àß (as2 = filter f1 (map f2 p_2))
  )"
  using assms
proof (induction p arbitrary: f1 f2 as1 as2)
  case Nil
  from Nil have 1: "as1 @ as2 = []"
    by force
  then have 2: "as1 = []" "as2 = []" 
    by blast+
  let ?p1="[]"
  let ?p2="[]"
  from 1 2 
  have "?p1 @ ?p2 = []" "as1 = (filter f1 (map f2 ?p1))" "as2 = (filter f1 (map f2 ?p2))"
    subgoal by blast
    subgoal using 2(1) by simp
    subgoal using 2(2) by simp
    done
  then show ?case 
    by fast
next
  case cons: (Cons a p)
  then show ?case 
  proof (cases "as1")
    case Nil
    from cons.prems Nil 
    have 1: "as2 = filter f1 (map f2 (a # p))" 
      by simp
    let ?p1="[]"
    let ?p2="a # p"
    have "?p1 @ ?p2 = a # p" "as1 = filter f1 (map f2 ?p1)" "as2 = filter f1 (map f2 ?p2)"
      subgoal by simp 
      subgoal using Nil by simp
      subgoal using 1 by auto
      done
    then show ?thesis 
      by blast
  next
    case (Cons a' p')
    then show ?thesis 
    proof (cases "¬¨f1 (f2 a)")
      case True
      hence "filter f1 (map f2 (a # p)) = filter f1 (map f2 p)"
        by fastforce
      hence "as1 @ as2 = filter f1 (map f2 p)" 
        using cons.prems 
        by argo
      then obtain p1 p2 where a:
        "p1 @ p2 = p" "as1 = filter f1 (map f2 p1)" "as2 = filter f1 (map f2 p2)" 
        using cons.IH 
        by meson
      let ?p1="a # p1"
      let ?p2="p2"
      have "?p1 @ ?p2 = a # p" "as1 = filter f1 (map f2 ?p1)" "as2 = filter f1 (map f2 ?p2)" 
        subgoal using a(1) by fastforce
        subgoal using True a(2) by auto
        subgoal using a(3) by blast
        done
      then show ?thesis 
        by blast
    next
      case False
      hence "filter f1 (map f2 (a # p)) = f2 a # filter f1 (map f2 p)"
        by fastforce
      then have 1: "a' = f2 a" "p' @ as2 = filter f1 (map f2 p)" "as1 = a' # p'" 
        using cons.prems Cons
        by fastforce+
      then obtain p1 p2 where 2:
        "p1 @ p2 = p" "p' = filter f1 (map f2 p1)" "as2 = filter f1 (map f2 p2)" 
        using cons.IH 
        by meson
      let ?p1="a # p1"
      let ?p2="p2"
      have "?p1 @ ?p2 = a # p" "as1 = filter f1 (map f2 ?p1)" "as2 = filter f1 (map f2 ?p2)"
        subgoal using 2(1) by simp
        subgoal using False 1(1, 3) 2(2) by force
        subgoal using 2(3) by blast
        done
      then show ?thesis
        by blast
    qed
  qed    
qed

‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE types of `f1` and `p` had to be fixed for `append\_eq\_as\_proj\_1`.‚Ä∫ 
lemma append_eq_as_proj_1: 
  fixes f1 :: "'a ‚áí bool" and f2 as1 as2 as3 and p :: "'a list"
  assumes "(as1 @ as2 @ as3 = filter f1 (map f2  p))"
  shows "(‚àÉp_1 p_2 p_3. 
    (p_1 @ p_2 @ p_3 = p) 
    ‚àß (as1 = filter f1 (map f2 p_1)) 
    ‚àß (as2 = filter f1 (map f2 p_2)) 
    ‚àß (as3 = filter f1 (map f2 p_3))
  )"
proof -
  from assms
  obtain p_1 p_2 where 1: "(p_1 @ p_2 = p)" "(as1 = filter f1 (map f2 p_1))" 
    "(as2 @ as3 = filter f1 (map f2 p_2))" 
    using append_filter[of as1 "(as2 @ as3)"]
    by meson
  moreover from 1 
  obtain p_a p_b where "(p_a @ p_b = p_2)" "(as2 = filter f1 (map f2 p_a))"
    "(as3 = filter f1 (map f2 p_b))" 
    using append_filter[where p=p_2]
    by meson
  ultimately show ?thesis
    by blast
qed

lemma filter_empty_every_not: "‚ãÄP l. (filter (Œªx. P x) l = []) = list_all (Œªx. ¬¨P x) l"
proof -
  fix P l
  show "(filter (Œªx. P x) l = []) = list_all (Œªx. ¬¨P x) l" 
    apply(induction l)
     apply(auto)
    done
qed

‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE added lemma (listScript.sml:810).‚Ä∫
lemma MEM_SPLIT:
  fixes x l
  assumes "¬¨ListMem x l" 
  shows "‚àÄl1 l2. l ‚â† l1 @ [x] @ l2" 
proof -
  {
    assume C: "¬¨(‚àÄl1 l2. l ‚â† l1 @ [x] @ l2)"
    then have "‚àÉl1 l2. l = l1 @ [x] @ l2"
      by blast
    then obtain l1 l2 where 1: "l = l1 @ [x] @ l2" 
      by blast
    from assms
    have 2: "(‚àÄxs. l ‚â† x # xs) ‚àß (‚àÄxs. (‚àÄy. l ‚â† y # xs) ‚à® ¬¨ ListMem x xs)"
      using ListMem_iff
      by fastforce
    then have False 
    proof (cases l1)
      case Nil
      let ?xs="l2"
      from 1 Nil have "l = [x] @ ?xs"
        by blast
      then show ?thesis 
        using 2
        by simp
    next
      case (Cons a list)
      {
        let ?y="a"
        let ?xs="list @ [x] @ l2"
        from 1 Cons have "l = ?y # ?xs"
          by simp
        moreover have "ListMem x ?xs"
          by (simp add: ListMem_iff)
        ultimately have "‚àÉxs. ‚àÉy. l = y # xs ‚àß ListMem x xs"
          by blast
        then have "¬¨(‚àÄxs. (‚àÄy. l ‚â† y # xs) ‚à® ¬¨ ListMem x xs)"
          by presburger
      }
      then show ?thesis 
        using 2
        by auto
    qed
  }
  then show ?thesis
    by blast
qed


‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE added lemma (listScript.sml:2784)‚Ä∫
lemma APPEND_EQ_APPEND_MID:
  fixes l1 l2 m1 m2 e
  shows 
    "(l1 @ [e] @ l2 = m1 @ m2) 
      ‚ü∑
        (‚àÉl. (m1 = l1 @ [e] @ l) ‚àß (l2 = l @ m2)) ‚à®
        (‚àÉl. (l1 = m1 @ l) ‚àß (m2 = l @ [e] @ l2))"
proof (induction "l1" arbitrary: m1)
  case Nil
  then show ?case
    by (simp; metis Cons_eq_append_conv)+
next
  case (Cons a l1)
  then show ?case
    by (cases m1; simp; blast)
qed

‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE variable `P` was removed (redundant).‚Ä∫
lemma LIST_FRAG_DICHOTOMY:
  fixes l la x lb
  assumes "sublist l (la @ [x] @ lb)" "¬¨ListMem x l"
  shows "sublist l la ‚à® sublist l lb"
proof -
  {
    from assms(1) 
    obtain pfx sfx where 1: "pfx @ l @ sfx = la @ [x] @ lb"
      unfolding sublist_def 
      by force
    from assms(2)
    have 2: "‚àÄl1 l2. l ‚â† l1 @ [x] @ l2"
      using MEM_SPLIT[OF assms(2)]
      by blast
    from 1 
    consider (a) "(‚àÉlc. pfx = la @ [x] @ lc ‚àß lb = lc @ l @ sfx)" 
      | (b) "(‚àÉlc. la = pfx @ lc ‚àß l @ sfx = lc @ [x] @ lb)"
      using APPEND_EQ_APPEND_MID[of la x lb pfx "l @ sfx"] 
      by presburger
    then have "‚àÉpfx' sfx. (pfx' @ l @ sfx = la) ‚à® (pfx'@  l @ sfx = lb)" 
    proof (cases)
      case a
        ‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE `lc` is `l'` in original proof.‚Ä∫
      then obtain lc where a: "pfx = la @ [x] @ lc" "lb = lc @ l @ sfx"
        by blast
      then show ?thesis
        by blast
    next
      case b
      then obtain lc where i: "la = pfx @ lc" "l @ sfx = lc @ [x] @ lb"
        by blast
      then show ?thesis
        using 2
        by (metis APPEND_EQ_APPEND_MID) 
    qed
  }
  then show ?thesis 
    unfolding sublist_def
    by blast
qed


lemma LIST_FRAG_DICHOTOMY_2:
  fixes l la x lb P
  assumes "sublist l (la @ [x] @ lb) " "¬¨P x" "list_all P l"
  shows "sublist l la ‚à® sublist l lb"
proof -
  {
    assume "¬¨P x" "list_all P l" 
    then have "¬¨ListMem x l" 
    proof (induction l arbitrary: x P) 
      case Nil
      then show ?case 
        using ListMem_iff
        by force
    next
      case (Cons a l)
      {
        have "list_all P l"
          using Cons.prems(2) 
          by simp
        then have "¬¨ListMem x l"
          using Cons.prems(1) Cons.IH
          by blast
      }
      moreover {
        have "P a" 
          using Cons.prems(2)
          by simp
        then  have "a ‚â† x" 
          using Cons.prems(1)
          by meson
      }
      ultimately show ?case
        using Cons.prems(1, 2) ListMem_iff list.pred_set
        by metis
    qed
  }
  then have "¬¨ListMem x l"
    using assms(2, 3) 
    by fast
  then show ?thesis 
    using assms(1) LIST_FRAG_DICHOTOMY
    by metis
qed

lemma frag_len_filter_le:
  fixes P l' l
  assumes "sublist l' l"
  shows "length (filter P l') ‚â§ length (filter P l)"
proof -
  obtain ps ss where "l = ps @ l' @ ss"
    using assms sublist_def 
    by blast
  then have 1:
    "length (filter P l) = length (filter P ps) + length (filter P l') + length (filter P ss)"
    by force 
  then have "length (filter P ps) ‚â• 0" "length (filter P ss) ‚â• 0" 
    by blast+ 
  then show ?thesis
    using 1
    by linarith
qed

end

Theory FSSublist

(*
 * cf. planning/hol/sublistScript
 *)
theory FSSublist
  imports Main "HOL-Library.Sublist" ListUtils
begin

text ‚Äπ This file is a port of the original HOL4 source file sublistScript.sml. ‚Ä∫

section "Factored System Sublist"
subsection "Sublist Characterization"

text ‚Äπ We take a look at the characterization of sublists. As a precursor, we are replacing the 
original definition of `sublist` in HOL4 (sublistScript.sml:10) with the semantically equivalent
`subseq` of Isabelle/HOL's to be able to use the associated theorems and automation. 

In HOL4 `sublist` is defined as
  
  (sublist [] l1 = T) /\
  (sublist (h::t) [] = F) /\
  (sublist (x::l1) (y::l2) = (x = y) /\ sublist l1 l2 \/ sublist (x::l1) l2)

[Abdulaziz et al., HOL4 Definition 10, p.19]. Whereas `subseq` (Sublist.tyh:927) is defined as an 
abbrevation of `list\_emb` with the predicate @{term "Œª x y. x = y"}, i.e. 

    @{term "subseq xs ys ‚â° list_emb (=) xs ys"}

`list\_emb` itself is defined as an inductive predicate. However, an equivalent function definition
is provided in `list\_emb\_code` (Sublist.thy:784) which is very close to `sublist` in HOL4.

The correctness of the equivalence claim is shown below by the technical lemma 
`sublist\_HOL4\_equiv\_subseq` (where the HOL4 definition of `sublist` is renamed to `sublist\_HOL4`).
‚Ä∫

‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE added definition‚Ä∫
fun sublist_HOL4 where
  "sublist_HOL4 [] l1 = True"
| "(sublist_HOL4 (h # t) [] = False)"
| "(sublist_HOL4 (x # l1) (y # l2) = ((x = y) ‚àß sublist_HOL4 l1 l2 ‚à® sublist_HOL4 (x # l1) l2))"


‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE added lemma‚Ä∫
lemma sublist_HOL4_equiv_subseq:
  fixes l1 l2
  shows "sublist_HOL4 l1 l2 ‚ü∑ subseq l1 l2" 
proof - 
  have "subseq l1 l2 = list_emb (Œªx y. x = y) l1 l2" 
    by blast
  moreover {
    have "sublist_HOL4 l1 l2 ‚ü∑ list_emb (Œªx y. x = y) l1 l2" 
    proof (induction rule: sublist_HOL4.induct)
      case (3 x l1 y l2)
      then show "sublist_HOL4 (x # l1) (y # l2) ‚ü∑ list_emb (Œªx y. x = y) (x # l1) (y # l2)" 
      proof (cases "x = y")
        case True
        then show ?thesis
          using "3.IH"(1, 2)
          by (metis sublist_HOL4.simps(3) subseq_Cons' subseq_Cons2_iff)
      next
        case False
        then show ?thesis
          using "3.IH"(2)
          by force
      qed 
    qed simp+
  }
  ultimately show ?thesis
    by blast
qed


text ‚Äπ Likewise as with `sublist` and `subseq`, the HOL4 definition of `list\_frag` 
(list\_utilsScript.sml:207) has a an Isabelle/HOL counterpart in `sublist` (Sublist.thy:1124).

The equivalence claim is proven in the technical lemma `list\_frag\_HOL4\_equiv\_sublist`. Note that
`sublist` reverses the argument order of `list\_frag`. Other than that, both definitions are
syntactically identical. ‚Ä∫
definition list_frag_HOL4 where
  "list_frag_HOL4 l frag ‚â° ‚àÉpfx sfx. pfx @ frag @ sfx = l"

lemma list_frag_HOL4_equiv_sublist:
  shows "list_frag_HOL4 l l' ‚ü∑ sublist l' l" 
  unfolding list_frag_HOL4_def sublist_def 
  by blast


text ‚Äπ Given these equivalences, occurences of `sublist` and `list\_frag` in the original HOL4 
source are now always translated directly to `subseq` and `sublist` respectively.

The remainer of this subsection is concerned with characterizations of `sublist`/ `subseq`. ‚Ä∫


lemma sublist_EQNS: 
  "subseq [] l = True" 
  "subseq (h # t) [] = False" 
  by auto


lemma sublist_refl: "subseq l l" 
  by auto


lemma sublist_cons: 
  assumes "subseq l1 l2"
  shows "subseq l1 (h # l2)" 
  using assms
  by blast


lemma sublist_NIL: "subseq l1 [] = (l1 = [])" 
  by fastforce


lemma sublist_trans: 
  fixes l1 l2
  assumes "subseq l1 l2" "subseq l2 l3" 
  shows "subseq l1 l3"
  using assms 
  by force 


‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE can be solved directly with 'list\_emb\_length'.‚Ä∫  
lemma sublist_length:
  fixes l l'
  assumes "subseq l l'"
  shows "length l ‚â§ length l'" 
  using assms list_emb_length
  by blast 


‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE can be solved directly with subseq\_Cons'.‚Ä∫
lemma sublist_CONS1_E: 
  fixes l1 l2
  assumes "subseq (h # l1) l2"
  shows "subseq l1 l2"
  using assms subseq_Cons'
  by metis


lemma sublist_equal_lengths: 
  fixes l1 l2
  assumes "subseq l1 l2" "(length l1 = length l2)"
  shows "(l1 = l2)" 
  using assms subseq_same_length
  by blast


‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE can be solved directly with 'subseq\_order.antisym'.‚Ä∫
lemma sublist_antisym: 
  assumes "subseq l1 l2" "subseq l2 l1"
  shows "(l1 = l2)"
  using assms subseq_order.antisym
  by blast


lemma sublist_append_back: 
  fixes l1 l2 
  shows "subseq l1 (l2 @ l1)" 
  by blast


‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE can be solved directly with 'subseq\_rev\_drop\_many'.‚Ä∫
lemma sublist_snoc: 
  fixes l1 l2 
  assumes "subseq l1 l2"
  shows "subseq l1 (l2 @ [h])"
  using assms subseq_rev_drop_many 
  by blast


lemma sublist_append_front: 
  fixes l1 l2
  shows "subseq l1 (l1 @ l2)"
  by fast


lemma append_sublist_1: 
  assumes "subseq (l1 @ l2) l"
  shows "subseq l1 l ‚àß subseq l2 l" 
  using assms sublist_append_back sublist_append_front sublist_trans 
  by blast 


‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE added lemma (eventually wasn't needed in the remaining proofs).‚Ä∫
lemma sublist_prefix:  
  shows "subseq (h # l1) l2 ‚üπ ‚àÉl2a l2b. l2 = l2a @ [h] @ l2b ‚àß ¬¨ListMem h l2a"
proof (induction l2 arbitrary: h l1)
  ‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE l2 cannot be empty when @{term "(h # l1)"} isn't.‚Ä∫
  case Nil
  have "¬¨(subseq (h # l1) [])"
    by simp 
  then show ?case 
    using Nil.prems
    by blast
next
  case (Cons a l2)
  then show ?case proof (cases "a = h")
    ‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE If a = h then a trivial solution exists in l2a = [] and l2b = l2.‚Ä∫
    case True
    then show "‚àÉ l2a l2b. (Cons a l2) = l2a @ [h] @ l2b ‚àß ¬¨ListMem h l2a" 
      using ListMem_iff 
      by force
  next 
    case False
    have "subseq (h # l1) l2" 
      using Cons.prems False subseq_Cons2_neq
      by force
    then obtain l2a l2b where "l2 = l2a @ [h] @ l2b" "¬¨ListMem h l2a"
      using Cons.IH Cons.prems
      by meson
    moreover have "a # l2 = (a # l2a) @ [h] @ l2b" 
      using calculation(1)
      by simp
    moreover have "¬¨(ListMem h (a # l2a))" 
      using False calculation(2) ListMem.simps
      by fastforce
    ultimately show ?thesis 
      by blast
  qed
qed

‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE added lemma (eventually wasn't needed in the remaining proofs).‚Ä∫
lemma sublist_skip: 
  fixes l1 l2 h l1'
  assumes "l1 = (h # l1')" "l2 = l2a @ [h] @ l2b" "subseq l1 l2" "¬¨(ListMem h l2a)"
  shows "subseq l1 (h # l2b)" 
  using assms
proof (induction l2a arbitrary: l1 l2 h l1')
  case Nil
  then have "l2 = h # l2b" 
    by fastforce
  then show ?case using Nil.prems(3)
    by blast
next
  case (Cons a l2a)
  have "a ‚â† h" 
    using Cons.prems(4) ListMem.simps 
    by fast
  then have "subseq l1 (l2a @ [h] @ l2b)"
    using Cons.prems(1, 2, 3) subseq_Cons2_neq
    by force
  moreover have "¬¨ListMem h l2a" 
    using Cons.prems(4) insert
    by metis
  ultimately have "subseq l1 (h # l2b)"
    using Cons.IH Cons.prems
    by meson 
  then show ?case
    by simp
qed

‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE added lemma (eventually wasn't needed in the remaining proofs).‚Ä∫
lemma sublist_split_trans:
  fixes l1 l2 h l1'
  assumes "l1 = (h # l1')" "l2 = l2a @ [h] @ l2b" "subseq l1 l2" "¬¨(ListMem h l2a)"
  shows "subseq l1' l2b"
proof -
  have "subseq (h # l1') (h # l2b)"
    using assms sublist_skip 
    by metis
  then show ?thesis
    using subseq_Cons2'
    by metis
qed

lemma sublist_cons_exists: 
  shows "
    subseq (h # l1) l2 
    ‚ü∑ (‚àÉl2a l2b. (l2 = l2a @ [h] @ l2b) ‚àß ¬¨ListMem h l2a ‚àß subseq l1 l2b)
  " 
proof -
  ‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE show both directions of the equivalence in pure proof blocks.‚Ä∫
  {
    have 
      "subseq (h # l1) l2 ‚üπ (‚àÉl2a l2b. (l2 = l2a @ [h] @ l2b) ‚àß ¬¨ListMem h l2a ‚àß subseq l1 l2b)" 
    proof (induction l2 arbitrary: h l1)
      case (Cons a l2)
      show ?case 
      proof (cases "a = h")
        case True
          ‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE This case has a trivial solution in '?l2a = []', '?l2b = l2'.‚Ä∫
        let ?l2a="[]"
        have "(a # l2) = ?l2a @ [h] @ l2" 
          using True
          by auto
        moreover have "¬¨(ListMem h ?l2a)"
          using ListMem_iff
          by force
        moreover have "subseq l1 l2" 
          using Cons.prems True 
          by simp
        ultimately show ?thesis
          by blast
      next
        case False
        have 1: "subseq (h # l1) l2" 
          using Cons.prems False subseq_Cons2_neq
          by metis
        then obtain l2a l2b where "l2 = l2a @ [h] @ l2b" "¬¨ListMem h l2a"
          using Cons.IH Cons.prems
          by meson
        moreover have "a # l2 = (a # l2a) @ [h] @ l2b" 
          using calculation(1)
          by simp
        moreover have "¬¨(ListMem h (a # l2a))" 
          using False calculation(2) ListMem.simps
          by fastforce
        ultimately show ?thesis 
          using 1 sublist_split_trans
          by metis
      qed
    qed simp
  }
  moreover
  {
    assume "‚àÉl2a l2b. (l2 = l2a @ [h] @ l2b) ‚àß ¬¨ListMem h l2a ‚àß subseq l1 l2b"
    then have  "subseq (h # l1) l2"
      by auto
  }
  ultimately show ?thesis
    by argo
qed


lemma sublist_append_exists: 
  fixes l1 l2 
  shows "subseq (l1 @ l2) l3 ‚üπ ‚àÉl3a l3b. (l3 = l3a @ l3b) ‚àß subseq l1 l3a ‚àß subseq l2 l3b"
  using list_emb_appendD 
  by fast


‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE can be solved directly with 'list\_emb\_append\_mono'.‚Ä∫
lemma sublist_append_both_I: 
  assumes "subseq a b" "subseq c d"
  shows "subseq (a @ c) (b @ d)"
  using assms list_emb_append_mono
  by blast


lemma sublist_append: 
  assumes "subseq l1 l1'" "subseq l2 l2'"
  shows "subseq (l1 @ l2) (l1' @ l2')"
  using assms sublist_append_both_I
  by blast


lemma sublist_append2: 
  assumes "subseq l1 l2"
  shows "subseq l1 (l2 @ l3)" 
  using assms sublist_append[of "l1" "l2" "[]" "l3"]
  by fast 


lemma append_sublist: 
  shows "subseq (l1 @ l2 @ l3) l ‚üπ subseq (l1 @ l3) l"
proof (induction l)
  case Nil
  then show ?case 
    using sublist_NIL
    by fastforce
next
  case (Cons a l)
  then show ?case 
  proof (cases l1)
    case Nil
    then show ?thesis
      using Cons.prems append_sublist_1 
      by auto
  next
    case (Cons a list)
    then show ?thesis
      using Cons.prems subseq_append' subseq_order.dual_order.trans
      by blast
  qed
qed


lemma sublist_subset: 
  assumes "subseq l1 l2"
  shows "set l1 ‚äÜ set l2" 
  using assms set_nths_subset subseq_conv_nths
  by metis


lemma sublist_filter: 
  fixes P l 
  shows "subseq (filter P l) l"
  using subseq_filter_left 
  by blast


lemma sublist_cons_2: 
  fixes l1 l2 h
  shows "(subseq (h # l1) (h # l2) ‚ü∑ (subseq l1 l2))"
  by fastforce


lemma sublist_every: 
  fixes l1 l2 P
  assumes "(subseq l1 l2 ‚àß list_all P l2)"
  shows "list_all P l1"
  by (metis (full_types) Ball_set assms list_emb_set)


lemma sublist_SING_MEM: "subseq [h] l ‚ü∑ ListMem h l"
  using ListMem_iff subseq_singleton_left
  by metis


‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE renamed due to previous declaration of `sublist\_append\_exists\_2.‚Ä∫
lemma sublist_append_exists_2: 
  fixes l1 l2 l3
  assumes "subseq (h # l1) l2"
  shows "(‚àÉl3 l4. (l2 = l3 @ [h] @ l4) ‚àß (subseq l1 l4))"
  using assms sublist_cons_exists
  by metis


lemma sublist_append_4: 
  fixes l l1 l2 h
  assumes "(subseq (h # l) (l1 @ [h] @ l2))" "(list_all (Œªx. ¬¨(h = x)) l1)"
  shows "subseq l l2"
  using assms 
proof (induction l1)
qed auto


lemma sublist_append_5: 
  fixes l l1 l2 h
  assumes "(subseq (h # l) (l1 @ l2))" "(list_all (Œªx. ¬¨(h = x)) l1)"
  shows "subseq (h # l) l2"
  using assms
proof (induction l1)
qed auto


lemma sublist_append_6: 
  fixes l l1 l2 h
  assumes "(subseq (h # l) (l1 @ l2))" "(¬¨(ListMem h l1))"
  shows "subseq (h # l) l2"
  using assms 
proof (induction l1)
  case (Cons a l1)
  then show ?case
    by (simp add: ListMem_iff) 
qed simp


lemma sublist_MEM: 
  fixes h l1 l2 
  shows "subseq (h # l1) l2 ‚üπ ListMem h l2"
proof (induction l2)
next
  case (Cons a l2)
  then show ?case
    using elem insert subseq_Cons2_neq 
    by metis
qed simp


lemma sublist_cons_4: 
  fixes l h l'
  shows "subseq l l' ‚üπ subseq l (h # l')" 
  using sublist_cons
  by blast


subsection "Main Theorems"

theorem sublist_imp_len_filter_le: 
  fixes P l l'
  assumes "subseq l' l" 
  shows "length (filter P l') ‚â§ length (filter P l)"
  using assms
  by (simp add: sublist_length)


‚Äï ‚ÄπTODO showcase (non-trivial proof translation/ obscurity).‚Ä∫
theorem list_with_three_types_shorten_type2: 
  fixes P1 P2 P3 k1 f PProbs PProbl s l
  assumes "(PProbs s)" "(PProbl l)" 
    "(‚àÄl s. 
      (PProbs s)
      ‚àß (PProbl l)
      ‚àß (list_all P1 l) 
      ‚ü∂ (‚àÉl'. 
          (f s l' = f s l) 
          ‚àß (length (filter P2 l') ‚â§ k1)
          ‚àß (length (filter P3 l') ‚â§ length (filter P3 l))
          ‚àß (list_all P1 l')
          ‚àß (subseq l' l)
      )
    )" 
    "(‚àÄs l1 l2. f (f s l1) l2 = f s (l1 @ l2))" 
    "(‚àÄs l. (PProbs s) ‚àß (PProbl l) ‚ü∂ (PProbs (f s l)))" 
    "(‚àÄl1 l2. (subseq l1 l2) ‚àß (PProbl l2) ‚ü∂ (PProbl l1))" 
    "(‚àÄl1 l2. PProbl (l1 @ l2) ‚ü∑ (PProbl l1 ‚àß PProbl l2))" 
  shows "(‚àÉl'. 
    (f s l' = f s l)
    ‚àß (length (filter P3 l') ‚â§ length (filter P3 l)) 
    ‚àß (‚àÄl''. 
      (sublist l'' l') ‚àß (list_all P1 l'')
       ‚ü∂ (length (filter P2 l'') ‚â§ k1)
    )
    ‚àß (subseq l' l)
  )"
  using assms 
proof (induction "filter (Œªx. ¬¨P1 x) l" arbitrary: P1 P2 P3 k1 f PProbs PProbl s l)
  case Nil
  then have "list_all (Œªx. P1 x) l" 
    using Nil(1) filter_empty_every_not[of "Œªx. ¬¨P1 x" l]
    by presburger
  then obtain l' where 1:
    "(f s l' = f s l)" "length (filter P2 l') ‚â§ k1" "length (filter P3 l') ‚â§ length (filter P3 l)" 
    "list_all P1 l'" "subseq l' l"
    using Nil.prems(1, 2, 3)
    by blast
  moreover {
    fix l''
    assume "sublist l'' l'" "list_all P1 l''"
    then have "subseq l'' l'"
      by blast
        ‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE original proof uses `frag\_len\_filter\_le` which however requires the fact
      `sublist l' ?l`. Unfortunately, this could not be derived in Isabelle/HOL.‚Ä∫
    then have "length (filter P2 l'') ‚â§ length (filter P2 l')" 
      using sublist_imp_len_filter_le
      by blast
    then have "length (filter P2 l'') ‚â§ k1"
      using 1
      by linarith
  }
  ultimately show ?case
    by blast
next
  case (Cons a x)
    ‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE The proof of the induction step basically consists of construction a list 
    `?l'=l'' @ [a] @ l'''` where `l''` and `l'''` are lists obtained from certain specifications
    of the induction hypothesis.‚Ä∫
  then obtain l1 l2 where 2: 
    "l = l1 @ a # l2" "(‚àÄu‚ààset l1. P1 u)" "¬¨ P1 a ‚àß x = [x‚Üêl2 . ¬¨ P1 x]"
    using Cons(2) filter_eq_Cons_iff[of "Œªx. ¬¨P1 x"] 
    by metis
  then have 3: "PProbl l2" 
    using Cons.prems(2, 6) 2(1) sublist_append_back 
    by blast
      ‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE Use the induction hypothesis to obtain a specific  `l'''`.‚Ä∫
  {
    have "x = filter (Œªx. ¬¨P1 x) l2"
      using 2(3)
      by blast
    moreover have "PProbs (f (f s l1) [a])"
      using Cons.prems(1, 2, 5, 6, 7) 2(1) elem sublist_SING_MEM
      by metis
    moreover have "‚àÄl s. PProbs s ‚àß PProbl l ‚àß list_all P1 l ‚ü∂ (‚àÉl'. 
      f s l' = f s l ‚àß length (filter P2 l') ‚â§ k1 ‚àß length (filter P3 l') ‚â§ length (filter P3 l)
      ‚àß list_all P1 l' ‚àß subseq l' l)"
      using Cons.prems(3)
      by blast
    moreover have "‚àÄs l1 l2. f (f s l1) l2 = f s (l1 @ l2)" 
      "‚àÄs l. PProbs s ‚àß PProbl l ‚ü∂ PProbs (f s l)" 
      "‚àÄl1 l2. subseq l1 l2 ‚àß PProbl l2 ‚ü∂ PProbl l1"
      "‚àÄl1 l2. PProbl (l1 @ l2) = (PProbl l1 ‚àß PProbl l2)"
      using Cons.prems(4, 5, 6, 7)
      by blast+
    ultimately have "‚àÉl'. 
      f (f (f s l1) [a]) l' = f (f (f s l1) [a]) l2 ‚àß length (filter P3 l') ‚â§ length (filter P3 l2)
      ‚àß (‚àÄl''. sublist l'' l' ‚àß list_all P1 l'' ‚ü∂ length (filter P2 l'') ‚â§ k1) ‚àß subseq l' l2" 
      using 3 Cons(1)[of P1 l2, where s="(f (f s l1) [a])"]
      by blast
  }
  then obtain l''' where 4:
    "f (f (f s l1) [a]) l''' = f (f (f s l1) [a]) l2" 
    "length (filter P3 l''') ‚â§ length (filter P3 l2)" 
    "(‚àÄl''. sublist l'' l''' ‚àß list_all P1 l'' ‚ü∂ length (filter P2 l'') ‚â§ k1) ‚àß subseq l''' l2" 
    by blast
  then have "f s (l1 @ [a] @ l''') = f s (l1 @ [a] @ l2)" 
    using Cons.prems(4)
    by auto
  then have "subseq l''' l2"
    using 4(3) 
    by blast
      ‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE Use the induction hypothesis to obtain a specific  `l''`.‚Ä∫
  {
    have "‚àÄl s. 
        PProbs s ‚àß PProbl l1 ‚àß list_all P1 l1 
        ‚ü∂ (‚àÉl''. 
          f s l'' = f s l1 ‚àß length (filter P2 l'') ‚â§ k1 ‚àß length (filter P3 l'') ‚â§ length (filter P3 l1)
          ‚àß list_all P1 l'' ‚àß subseq l'' l1)"
      using Cons.prems(3)
      by blast
    then have "‚àÉl''. 
        f s l'' = f s l1 ‚àß length (filter P2 l'') ‚â§ k1 ‚àß length (filter P3 l'') ‚â§ length (filter P3 l1)
        ‚àß list_all P1 l'' ‚àß subseq l'' l1"
      using Cons.prems(1, 2, 7) 2(1, 2) 
      by (metis Ball_set) 
  }

  then obtain l'' where 5:
    "f s l'' = f s l1" "length (filter P2 l'') ‚â§ k1" 
    "length (filter P3 l'') ‚â§ length (filter P3 l1)" "list_all P1 l'' ‚àß subseq l'' l1"
    by blast
  text ‚Äπ Proof the proposition by providing the witness @{term "l'=(l'' @ [a] @ l''')"}. ‚Ä∫
  let ?l'="(l'' @ [a] @ l''') " 
  {
    have "‚àÄs l1 l2. f (f s l1) l2 = f s (l1 @ l2)"
      by (simp add: Cons.prems(4))
    text ‚Äπ Rewrite and show the goal.‚Ä∫
    have "f s ?l' = f s (l1 @ [a] @ l2) ‚ü∑ f s (l'' @ (a # l''')) = f s (l1 @ (a # l2))"
      by simp
    also have "‚Ä¶ ‚ü∑ f (f (f s l1) [a]) l''' = f (f (f s l1) [a]) l2"
      by (metis Cons.prems(4) ‚Äπf s l'' = f s l1‚Ä∫ calculation)
    finally have "f s ?l' = f s (l1 @ [a] @ l2)" 
      using 4(1)
      by blast
  }
  moreover 
  {
    have "
      length (filter P3 ?l') ‚â§ length (filter P3 (l1 @ [a] @ l2))
      ‚ü∑ 
        (length (filter P3 l'') + 1 + length (filter P3 l''') 
        ‚â§ length (filter P3 l1) + 1 + length (filter P3 l2))"
      by force
    then have " 
      length (filter P3 ?l') ‚â§ length (filter P3 (l1 @ [a] @ l2))
      ‚ü∑
        length (filter P3 l'') + length (filter P3 l''') 
        ‚â§ length (filter P3 l1) + length (filter P3 l2)"
      by linarith
    then have "length (filter P3 ?l') ‚â§ length (filter P3 (l1 @ [a] @ l2))"
      using 4(2) ‚Äπlength (filter P3 l'') ‚â§ length (filter P3 l1)‚Ä∫ 
        add_mono_thms_linordered_semiring(1) 
      by blast
  }
  moreover 
  {
    fix l''''
    assume P: "sublist l'''' ?l'" "list_all P1 l''''"
    have "list_all P1 l1"
      using 2(2) Ball_set
      by blast 
    consider (i) "sublist l'''' l''" | (ii) "sublist l'''' l'''"
      using P(1, 2) 2(3)  LIST_FRAG_DICHOTOMY_2
      by metis
    then have "length (filter P2 l'''') ‚â§ k1" 
    proof (cases)
      case i
      then have "length (filter P2 l'''') ‚â§ length (filter P2 l'')"
        using frag_len_filter_le
        by blast
      then show ?thesis 
        using 5(2) order_trans
        by blast
    next
      case ii
      then show ?thesis
        using 4(3) P(2)
        by blast
    qed
  }
    ‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE the following two steps seem to be necessary to convince Isabelle that the split 
  @{term "l = l1 @ a # l2"} matches the split `(l1 @ [a] @ l2` and the previous proof steps therefore is 
  prove the goal.‚Ä∫
  moreover {
    have "subseq ?l' (l1 @ [a] @ l2)"
      by (simp add: FSSublist.sublist_append ‚Äπlist_all P1 l'' ‚àß subseq l'' l1‚Ä∫ ‚Äπsubseq l''' l2‚Ä∫)
  }
  moreover have "l = l1 @ [a] @ l2"
    using 2 
    by force
  ultimately show ?case 
    by blast
qed


lemma isPREFIX_sublist: 
  fixes x y
  assumes "prefix x y"
  shows "subseq x y"
  using assms prefix_order.dual_order.antisym 
  by blast

end

Theory HoArithUtils

theory HoArithUtils
  imports Main
begin

lemma general_theorem: 
  fixes P f and l :: nat
  assumes "(‚àÄp. P p ‚àß f p > l ‚ü∂ (‚àÉp'. P p' ‚àß f p' < f p))"
  shows "(‚àÄp. P p ‚ü∂ (‚àÉp'. P p' ‚àß f p' ‚â§ l))"
proof-
  have "‚àÄp. (n = f p) ‚àß P p ‚ü∂ (‚àÉp'. P p' ‚àß f p' ‚â§ l)" for n
    apply(rule Nat.nat_less_induct[where ?P = "%n. ‚àÄp. (n = f p) ‚àß P p ‚ü∂ (‚àÉp'. P p' ‚àß f p' ‚â§ l)"])
    by (metis assms not_less)
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

end

Theory FmapUtils

theory FmapUtils
  imports "HOL-Library.Finite_Map" FactoredSystemLib
begin

‚Äï ‚ÄπTODO
  A lemma 'fmrestrict\_set\_twice\_eq'
    'fmrestrict\_set ?vs (fmrestrict\_set ?vs ?f) = fmrestrict\_set ?vs ?f'
to replace the recurring proofs steps using 'by (simp add: fmfilter\_alt\_defs(4))' would make sense.‚Ä∫


‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE hide the '++' operator from 'Map' to prevent warnings.‚Ä∫
hide_const (open) Map.map_add
no_notation Map.map_add (infixl "++" 100)

‚Äï ‚ÄπTODO more explicit proof.‚Ä∫
lemma IN_FDOM_DRESTRICT_DIFF:
  fixes vs v f
  assumes "¬¨(v ‚àà vs)" "fmdom' f ‚äÜ fdom" "v ‚àà fmdom' f"
  shows "v ‚àà fmdom' (fmrestrict_set (fdom - vs) f)"
  using assms
  by (metis DiffI Int_def Int_iff Set.filter_def fmdom'_filter fmfilter_alt_defs(4) inf.order_iff)

lemma disj_dom_drest_fupdate_eq: "
  disjnt (fmdom' x) vs ‚üπ (fmrestrict_set vs s = fmrestrict_set vs (x ++ s))
"
proof -
  fix vs s x
  assume P: "disjnt (fmdom' x) vs"
  moreover have 1: "‚àÄx''. (x'' ‚àà vs) ‚ü∂ (fmlookup (x ++ s) x'' = fmlookup s  x'')"
    by (metis calculation disjnt_iff fmap_add_ltr_def fmdom'_notD fmdom_notI fmlookup_add)
  moreover
  {
    fix x''
    have "fmlookup (fmrestrict_set vs s) x'' = fmlookup (fmrestrict_set vs (x ++ s)) x''"
      apply(cases "x'' ‚àâ fmdom' x")
       apply(cases "x'' ‚àâ vs")
        apply(auto simp add: "1")
      done
  }
  ultimately show "(fmrestrict_set vs s = fmrestrict_set vs (x ++ s))"
    using fmap_ext by blast
qed

‚Äï ‚ÄπTODO refactor into 'FmapUtils.thy'.‚Ä∫
lemma graph_plan_card_state_set:
  fixes PROB vs
  assumes "finite vs"
  shows "card (fmdom' (fmrestrict_set vs s)) ‚â§ card vs"
proof -
  let ?vs' = "fmdom' (fmrestrict_set vs s)"
  have "?vs' ‚äÜ vs"
    using fmdom'_restrict_set
    by metis
  moreover have "card ?vs' ‚â§ card vs"
    using assms calculation card_mono
    by blast
  ultimately show ?thesis by blast
qed

lemma exec_drest_5:
  fixes x vs
  assumes "fmdom' x ‚äÜ vs"
  shows "(fmrestrict_set vs x = x)"
proof -
  ‚Äï ‚ÄπTODO refactor and make into ISAR proof.‚Ä∫
  {
    fix v
    have "fmlookup (fmrestrict_set vs x) v = fmlookup x v"
      apply(cases "v ‚àà fmdom' x")
      subgoal using assms by auto
      subgoal by (simp add: fmdom'_notD)
      done
    then have "fmlookup (fmrestrict_set vs x) v = fmlookup x v"
      by fast
  }
  moreover have "fmlookup (fmrestrict_set vs x) = fmlookup x"
    using calculation fmap_ext
    by auto
  ultimately show ?thesis
    using fmlookup_inject
    by blast
qed

lemma graph_plan_lemma_5:
  fixes s s' vs
  assumes "(fmrestrict_set (fmdom' s - vs) s = fmrestrict_set (fmdom' s' - vs) s')"
    "(fmrestrict_set vs s = fmrestrict_set vs s')"
  shows "(s = s')"
proof -
  have "‚àÄx. fmlookup s x = fmlookup s' x"
    using assms(1, 2) fmdom'_notD fminusI fmlookup_restrict_set Diff_iff
    by metis
  then show ?thesis using fmap_ext
    by blast
qed

lemma drest_smap_drest_smap_drest:
  fixes x s vs
  shows "fmrestrict_set vs x ‚äÜ‚á©f s ‚ü∑ fmrestrict_set vs x ‚äÜ‚á©f fmrestrict_set vs s"
proof -
  ‚Äï ‚ÄπTODO this could be refactored into standalone lemma since it's very common in proofs.‚Ä∫
  have 1: "fmlookup (fmrestrict_set vs s) ‚äÜ‚á©m fmlookup s"
    by (metis fmdom'.rep_eq fmdom'_notI fmlookup_restrict_set map_le_def)
  moreover
  {
    assume P1: "fmrestrict_set vs x ‚äÜ‚á©f s"
    moreover have 2: "fmlookup (fmrestrict_set vs x) ‚äÜ‚á©m fmlookup s"
      using P1 fmsubset.rep_eq by blast
    {
      fix v
      assume "v ‚àà fmdom' (fmrestrict_set vs x)"
      then have "fmlookup (fmrestrict_set vs x) v = fmlookup (fmrestrict_set vs s) v"
        by (metis (full_types) "2" domIff fmdom'_notI fmlookup_restrict_set map_le_def)
    }
    ultimately have "fmrestrict_set vs x ‚äÜ‚á©f fmrestrict_set vs s"
      unfolding fmsubset.rep_eq
      by (simp add: map_le_def)
  }
  moreover
  {
    assume P2: "fmrestrict_set vs x ‚äÜ‚á©f fmrestrict_set vs s"
    moreover have "fmrestrict_set vs s ‚äÜ‚á©f s"
      using 1 fmsubset.rep_eq
      by blast
    ultimately have "fmrestrict_set vs x ‚äÜ‚á©f s"
      using fmsubset.rep_eq map_le_trans
      by blast
  }
  ultimately show ?thesis by blast
qed

lemma sat_precond_as_proj_1:
  fixes s s' vs x
  assumes "fmrestrict_set vs s = fmrestrict_set vs s'"
  shows "fmrestrict_set vs x ‚äÜ‚á©f s ‚ü∑ fmrestrict_set vs x ‚äÜ‚á©f s'"
  using assms drest_smap_drest_smap_drest
  by metis

lemma sat_precond_as_proj_4:
  fixes fm1 fm2 vs
  assumes "fm2 ‚äÜ‚á©f fm1"
  shows "(fmrestrict_set vs fm2 ‚äÜ‚á©f fm1)"
  using assms fmpred_restrict_set fmsubset_alt_def
  by metis

lemma sublist_as_proj_eq_as_1:
  fixes x s vs
  assumes "(x ‚äÜ‚á©f fmrestrict_set vs s)"
  shows "(x ‚äÜ‚á©f s)"
  using assms
  by (meson fmsubset.rep_eq fmsubset_alt_def fmsubset_pred drest_smap_drest_smap_drest map_le_refl)

lemma limited_dom_neq_restricted_neq:
  assumes "fmdom' f1 ‚äÜ vs" "f1 ++ f2 ‚â† f2"
  shows "fmrestrict_set vs (f1 ++ f2) ‚â† fmrestrict_set vs f2"
proof -
  {
    assume C: "fmrestrict_set vs (f1 ++ f2) = fmrestrict_set vs f2"
    then have "‚àÄx ‚àà fmdom' (fmrestrict_set vs (f1 ++ f2)).
      fmlookup (fmrestrict_set vs (f1 ++ f2)) x
      = fmlookup (fmrestrict_set vs f2) x"
      by simp
    obtain v where a: "v ‚àà fmdom' f1" "fmlookup (f1 ++ f2) v ‚â† fmlookup f2 v"
      using assms(2)
      by (metis fmap_add_ltr_def fmap_ext fmdom'_notD fmdom_notI fmlookup_add)
    then have b: "v ‚àà vs"
      using assms(1)
      by blast
    moreover {
      have "fmdom' (fmrestrict_set vs (f1 ++ f2)) = vs ‚à© fmdom' (f1 ++ f2)"
        by (simp add: fmdom'_alt_def fmfilter_alt_defs(4))
      then have "v ‚àà fmdom' (fmrestrict_set vs (f1 ++ f2))"
        using C a b
        by fastforce
    }
    then have False
      by (metis C a(2) calculation fmlookup_restrict_set)
  }
  then show ?thesis
    by auto
qed

lemma fmlookup_fmrestrict_set_dom: "‚ãÄvs s. dom (fmlookup (fmrestrict_set vs s)) = vs ‚à© (fmdom' s)"
by (auto simp add: fmdom'_restrict_set_precise)

end

Theory FactoredSystem

theory FactoredSystem
  imports Main "HOL-Library.Finite_Map" "HOL-Library.Sublist" FSSublist
    FactoredSystemLib ListUtils HoArithUtils FmapUtils
begin


section "Factored System"

‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE hide the '++' operator from 'Map' to prevent warnings.‚Ä∫
hide_const (open) Map.map_add
no_notation Map.map_add (infixl "++" 100)


subsection "Semantics of Plan Execution"

text ‚Äπ This section aims at characterizing the semantics of executing plans---i.e. sequences
of actions---on a given initial state.

The semantics of action execution were previously introduced
via the notion of succeding state (`state\_succ`). Plan execution (`exec\_plan`) extends this notion
to sequences of actions by calculating the succeding state from the given state and action pair and
then recursively executing the remaining actions on the succeding state. [Abdulaziz et al., HOL4
Definition 3, p.9] ‚Ä∫


lemma state_succ_pair: "state_succ s (p, e) = (if (p ‚äÜ‚á©f s) then (e ++ s) else s)"
  by (simp add: state_succ_def)


‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE shortened to 'exec\_plan'‚Ä∫
‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE using 'fun' because of multiple definining equations.‚Ä∫
‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE first argument was curried.‚Ä∫
fun exec_plan where
  "exec_plan s [] = s"
| "exec_plan s (a # as) = exec_plan (state_succ s a) as"


lemma exec_plan_Append:
  fixes as_a as_b s
  shows "exec_plan s (as_a @ as_b) = exec_plan (exec_plan s as_a) as_b"
  by (induction as_a arbitrary: s as_b) auto


text ‚Äπ Plan execution effectively eliminates cycles: i.e., if a given plan `as` may be partitioned
into plans `as1`, `as2` and `as3`, s.t. the sequential execution of `as1` and `as2` yields the same
state, `as2` may be skipped during plan execution. ‚Ä∫

lemma cycle_removal_lemma:
  fixes as1 as2 as3
  assumes "(exec_plan s (as1 @ as2) = exec_plan s as1)"
  shows "(exec_plan s (as1 @ as2 @ as3) = exec_plan s (as1 @ as3))"
  using assms exec_plan_Append
  by metis


subsubsection "Characterization of the Set of Possible States"

text ‚Äπ To show the construction principle of the set of possible states---in lemma
`construction\_of\_all\_possible\_states\_lemma`---the following ancillary proves of finite map
properties are required.

Most importantly, in lemma `fmupd\_fmrestrict\_subset` we show how finite mappings `s` with domain
@{term "{v} ‚à™ X"} and `s v = (Some x)` are constructed from their restrictions to `X` via update, i.e.

  s = fmupd v x (fmrestrict\_set X s)

This is used in lemma `construction\_of\_all\_possible\_states\_lemma` to show that the set of possible
states for variables @{term "{v} ‚à™ X"} is constructed inductively from the set of all possible states for
variables `X` via update on point @{term "v ‚àâ X"}.
‚Ä∫

‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE added lemma.‚Ä∫
lemma empty_domain_fmap_set: "{s. fmdom' s = {}} = {fmempty}"
proof -
  let ?A = "{s. fmdom' s = {}}"
  let ?B = "{fmempty}"
  fix s
  show ?thesis proof(rule ccontr)
    assume C: "?A ‚â† ?B"
    then show False proof -
      {
        assume C1: "?A ‚äÇ ?B"
        have "?A = {}" using C1 by force
        then have False using fmdom'_empty by blast
      }
      moreover
      {
        assume C2: "¬¨(?A ‚äÇ ?B)"
        then have "fmdom' fmempty = {}"
          by auto
        moreover have "fmempty ‚àà ?A"
          by auto
        moreover have "?A ‚â† {}"
          using calculation(2) by blast
        moreover have "‚àÄa‚àà?A.a‚àâ?B"
          by (metis (mono_tags, lifting)
              C Collect_cong calculation(1) fmrestrict_set_dom fmrestrict_set_null singleton_conv)
        moreover have "fmempty ‚àà ?B" by auto
        moreover have "‚àÉa‚àà?A.a‚àà?B"
          by simp
        moreover have "¬¨(‚àÄa‚àà?A.a‚àâ?B)"
          by simp
        ultimately have False
          by blast
      }
      ultimately show False
        by fastforce
    qed
  qed
qed

‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE added lemma.‚Ä∫
lemma possible_states_set_ii_a:
  fixes s x v
  assumes "(v ‚àà fmdom' s)"
  shows "(fmdom' ((Œªs. fmupd v x s) s) = fmdom' s)"
  using assms insert_absorb
  by auto

‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE added lemma.‚Ä∫
lemma possible_states_set_ii_b:
  fixes s x v
  assumes "(v ‚àâ fmdom' s)"
  shows "(fmdom' ((Œªs. fmupd v x s) s) = fmdom' s ‚à™ {v})"
  by auto

‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE added lemma.‚Ä∫
lemma fmap_neq:
  fixes s :: "('a, bool) fmap" and s' :: "('a, bool) fmap"
  assumes "(fmdom' s = fmdom' s')"
  shows "((s ‚â† s') ‚ü∑ (‚àÉv‚àà(fmdom' s). fmlookup s v ‚â† fmlookup s' v))"
  using assms fmap_ext fmdom'_notD
  by metis

‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE added lemma.‚Ä∫
lemma fmdom'_fmsubset_restrict_set:
  fixes X1 X2 and s :: "('a, bool) fmap"
  assumes "X1 ‚äÜ X2" "fmdom' s = X2"
  shows "fmdom' (fmrestrict_set X1 s) = X1"
  using assms
  by (metis (no_types, lifting)
      antisym_conv fmdom'_notD fmdom'_notI fmlookup_restrict_set rev_subsetD subsetI)


‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE added lemma.‚Ä∫
lemma fmsubset_restrict_set:
  fixes X1 X2 and s :: "'a state"
  assumes "X1 ‚äÜ X2" "s ‚àà {s. fmdom' s = X2}"
  shows "fmrestrict_set X1 s ‚àà {s. fmdom' s = X1}"
  using assms fmdom'_fmsubset_restrict_set
  by blast

‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE added lemma.‚Ä∫
lemma fmupd_fmsubset_restrict_set:
  fixes X v x and s :: "'a state"
  assumes "s ‚àà {s. fmdom' s = insert v X}" "fmlookup s v = Some x"
  shows "s = fmupd v x (fmrestrict_set X s)"
proof -
  ‚Äï ‚ÄπShow that domains of 's' and 'fmupd v x (fmrestrict\_set X s)' are identical.‚Ä∫
  have 1: "fmdom' s = insert v X"
    using assms(1)
    by simp
  {
    have "X ‚äÜ insert v X"
      by auto
    then have "fmdom' (fmrestrict_set X s) = X"
      using 1 fmdom'_fmsubset_restrict_set
      by metis
    then have "fmdom' (fmupd v x (fmrestrict_set X s)) = insert v X"
      using assms(1) fmdom'_fmupd
      by auto
  }
  note 2 = this
  moreover
  {
    fix w
      ‚Äï ‚ÄπShow case for undefined variables (where lookup yields 'None').‚Ä∫
    {
      assume "w ‚àâ insert v X"
      then have "w ‚àâ fmdom' s" "w ‚àâ fmdom' (fmupd v x (fmrestrict_set X s))"
        using 1 2
        by argo+
      then have "fmlookup s w = fmlookup (fmupd v x (fmrestrict_set X s)) w"
        using fmdom'_notD
        by metis
    }
      ‚Äï ‚ÄπShow case for defined variables (where lookup yields 'Some y').‚Ä∫
    moreover {
      assume "w ‚àà insert v X"
      then have "w ‚àà fmdom' s" "w ‚àà fmdom' (fmupd v x (fmrestrict_set X s))"
        using 1 2
        by argo+
      then have "fmlookup s w = fmlookup (fmupd v x (fmrestrict_set X s)) w"
        by (cases "w = v")
          (auto simp add: assms calculation)
    }
    ultimately have "fmlookup s w = fmlookup (fmupd v x (fmrestrict_set X s)) w"
      by blast
  }
  then show ?thesis
    using fmap_ext
    by blast
qed

lemma construction_of_all_possible_states_lemma:
  fixes v X
  assumes "(v ‚àâ X)"
  shows "({s. fmdom' s = insert v X}
    = ((Œªs. fmupd v True s) ` {s. fmdom' s = X})
      ‚à™ ((Œªs. fmupd v False s) ` {s. fmdom' s = X})
  )"
proof -
  fix v X
  let ?A = "{s :: 'a state. fmdom' s = insert v X}"
  let ?B = "
    ((Œªs. fmupd v True s) ` {s :: 'a state. fmdom' s = X})
    ‚à™ ((Œªs. fmupd v False s) ` {s :: 'a state. fmdom' s = X})
  "
  text ‚ÄπShow the goal by mutual inclusion. The inclusion @{term "?B ‚äÜ ?A"} is trivial and can be solved by
    automation. For the complimentary proof @{term "?A ‚äÜ ?B"} however we need to do more work.
    In our case we choose a proof by contradiction and show that an @{term "s ‚àà ?A"} which is not also in
    '?B' cannot exist.‚Ä∫
  {
    have "?A ‚äÜ ?B" proof(rule ccontr)
      assume C: "¬¨(?A ‚äÜ ?B)"
      moreover have "‚àÉs‚àà?A. s‚àâ?B"
        using C
        by auto
      moreover obtain s where obtain_s: "s‚àà?A ‚àß s‚àâ?B"
        using calculation
        by auto
      moreover have "s‚àâ?B"
        using obtain_s
        by auto
      moreover have "fmdom' s = X ‚à™ {v}"
        using obtain_s
        by auto
      moreover have "‚àÄs'‚àà?B. fmdom' s' = X ‚à™ {v}"
        by auto
      moreover have
        "(s ‚àâ ((Œªs. fmupd v True s) ` {s. fmdom' s = X}))"
        "(s ‚àâ ((Œªs. fmupd v False s) ` {s. fmdom' s = X}))"
        using obtain_s
        by blast+
      text ‚Äπ Show that every state @{term "s ‚àà ?A"} has been constructed from another state with domain
        'X'. ‚Ä∫
      moreover
      {
        fix s :: "'a state"
        assume 1: "s ‚àà {s :: 'a state. fmdom' s = insert v X}"
        then have "fmrestrict_set X s ‚àà {s :: 'a state. fmdom' s = X}"
          using subset_insertI fmsubset_restrict_set
          by metis
        moreover
        {
          assume "fmlookup s v = Some True"
          then have "s = fmupd v True (fmrestrict_set X s)"
            using 1 fmupd_fmsubset_restrict_set
            by metis
        }
        moreover {
          assume "fmlookup s v = Some False"
          then have "s = fmupd v False (fmrestrict_set X s)"
            using 1 fmupd_fmsubset_restrict_set
            by fastforce
        }
        moreover have "fmlookup s v ‚â† None"
          using 1 fmdom'_notI
          by fastforce
        ultimately have "
          (s ‚àà ((Œªs. fmupd v True s) ` {s. fmdom' s = X}))
          ‚à® (s ‚àà ((Œªs. fmupd v False s) ` {s. fmdom' s = X}))
        "
          by force
      }
      ultimately show False
        by meson
    qed
  }
  moreover have "?B ‚äÜ ?A"
    by force
  ultimately show "?A = ?B" by blast
qed


text ‚Äπ Another important property of the state set is cardinality, i.e. the number of distinct
states which can be modelled using a given finite variable set.

As lemma `card\_of\_set\_of\_all\_possible\_states` shows, for a finite variable set `X`, the number of
possible states is `2 \^ card X`, i.e. the number of assigning two discrete values to `card X` slots
as known from combinatorics.

Again, some additional properties of finite maps had to be proven. Pivotally, in lemma
`updates\_disjoint`, it is shown that the image of updating a set of states with domain `X` on a
point @{term "x ‚àâ X"} with either `True` or `False` yields two distinct sets of states with domain
@{term "{x} ‚à™ X"}. ‚Ä∫

‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE goal has to stay implication otherwise induction rule won't watch.‚Ä∫
lemma FINITE_states:
  fixes X :: "'a set"
  shows "finite X ‚üπ finite {(s :: 'a state). fmdom' s = X}"
proof (induction  rule: finite.induct)
  case emptyI
  then have "{s. fmdom' s  = {}} = {fmempty}"
    by (simp add: empty_domain_fmap_set)
  then show ?case
    by (simp add: ‚Äπ{s. fmdom' s = {}} = {fmempty}‚Ä∫)
next
  case (insertI A a)
  assume P1: "finite A"
    and P2: "finite {s. fmdom' s = A}"
  then show ?case
  proof (cases "a ‚àà A")
    case True
    then show ?thesis
      using insertI.IH insert_Diff
      by fastforce
  next
    case False
    then show ?thesis
    proof -
      have "finite (
          ((Œªs. fmupd a True s) ` {s. fmdom' s = A})
            ‚à™ ((Œªs. fmupd a False s) ` {s. fmdom' s = A}))"
        using False construction_of_all_possible_states_lemma insertI.IH
        by blast
      then show ?thesis
        using False construction_of_all_possible_states_lemma
        by fastforce
    qed
  qed
qed

‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE added lemma.‚Ä∫
lemma bool_update_effect:
  fixes s X x v b
  assumes "finite X" "s ‚àà {s :: 'a state. fmdom' s = X}" "x ‚àà X" "x ‚â† v"
  shows "fmlookup ((Œªs :: 'a state. fmupd v b s) s) x = fmlookup s x"
  using assms fmupd_lookup
  by auto

‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE added lemma.‚Ä∫
lemma bool_update_inj:
  fixes X :: "'a set" and v b
  assumes "finite X" "v ‚àâ X"
  shows "inj_on (Œªs. fmupd v b s) {s :: 'a state. fmdom' s = X}"
proof -
  let ?f = "Œªs :: 'a state. fmupd v b s"
  {
    fix s1 s2 :: "'a state"
    assume "s1 ‚àà {s :: 'a state. fmdom' s = X}" "s2 ‚àà {s :: 'a state. fmdom' s = X}"
      "?f s1 = ?f s2"
    moreover
    {
      have
        "‚àÄx‚ààX. x ‚â† v ‚ü∂ fmlookup (?f s1) x = fmlookup s1 x"
        "‚àÄx‚ààX. x ‚â† v ‚ü∂ fmlookup (?f s2) x = fmlookup s2 x"
        by simp+
      then have
        "‚àÄx‚ààX. x ‚â† v ‚ü∂ fmlookup s1 x = fmlookup s2 x"
        using calculation(3)
        by auto
    }
    moreover have "fmlookup s1 v = fmlookup s2 v"
      using calculation ‚Äπv ‚àâ X‚Ä∫
      by force
    ultimately have "s1 = s2"
      using fmap_neq
      by fastforce
  }
  then show "inj_on (Œªs. fmupd v b s) {s :: 'a state. fmdom' s = X}"
    using inj_onI
    by blast
qed

‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE added lemma.‚Ä∫
lemma card_update:
  fixes X v b
  assumes "finite (X :: 'a set)" "v ‚àâ X"
  shows "
    card ((Œªs. fmupd v b s) ` {s :: 'a state. fmdom' s = X})
    = card {s :: 'a state. fmdom' s = X}
  "
proof -
  have "inj_on (Œªs. fmupd v b s) {s :: 'a state. fmdom' s = X}"
    using assms bool_update_inj
    by fast
  then show
    "card ((Œªs. fmupd v b s) ` {s :: 'a state. fmdom' s = X}) = card {s :: 'a state. fmdom' s = X}"
    using card_image by blast
qed

‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE added lemma.‚Ä∫
lemma updates_disjoint:
  fixes X x
  assumes "finite X" "x ‚àâ X"
  shows "
    ((Œªs. fmupd x True s) ` {s. fmdom' s = X})
    ‚à© ((Œªs. fmupd x False s) ` {s. fmdom' s = X}) = {}
  "
proof -
  let ?A = "((Œªs. fmupd x True s) ` {s. fmdom' s = X})"
  let ?B = "((Œªs. fmupd x False s) ` {s. fmdom' s = X})"
  {
    assume C: "¬¨(‚àÄa‚àà?A. ‚àÄb‚àà?B. a ‚â† b)"
    then have
      "‚àÄa‚àà?A. ‚àÄb‚àà?B. fmlookup a x ‚â† fmlookup b x"
      by simp
    then have "‚àÄa‚àà?A. ‚àÄb‚àà?B. a ‚â† b"
      by blast
    then have False
      using C
      by blast
  }
  then show "?A ‚à© ?B = {}"
    using disjoint_iff_not_equal
    by blast
qed


lemma card_of_set_of_all_possible_states:
  fixes X :: "'a set"
  assumes "finite X"
  shows "card {(s :: 'a state). fmdom' s = X} = 2 ^ (card X)"
  using assms
proof (induction X)
  case empty
  then have 1: "{s :: 'a state. fmdom' s = {}} = {fmempty}"
    using empty_domain_fmap_set
    by simp
  then have "card {fmempty} = 1"
    using is_singleton_altdef
    by blast
  then have "2^(card {}) = 1"
    by auto
  then show ?case
    using 1
    by auto
next
  case (insert x F)
  then show ?case
    ‚Äï ‚ÄπTODO refactor and simplify proof further.‚Ä∫
  proof (cases "x ‚àà F")
    case True
    then show ?thesis
      using insert.hyps(2)
      by blast
  next
    case False
    then have "
        {s :: 'a state. fmdom' s = insert x F}
        = (Œªs. fmupd x True s) ` {s. fmdom' s = F} ‚à™ (Œªs. fmupd x False s) ` {s. fmdom' s = F}
      "
      using False construction_of_all_possible_states_lemma
      by metis
    then have 2: "
        card ({s :: 'a state. fmdom' s = insert x F})
        = card ((Œªs. fmupd x True s) ` {s. fmdom' s = F} ‚à™ (Œªs. fmupd x False s) ` {s. fmdom' s = F})
      "
      by argo
    then have 3: "2^(card (insert x F)) = 2 * 2^(card F)"
      using False insert.hyps(1)
      by simp
    then have
      "card ((Œªs. fmupd x True s) ` {s. fmdom' s = F}) = 2^(card F)"
      "card ((Œªs. fmupd x False s) ` {s. fmdom' s = F}) = 2^(card F)"
      using False card_update insert.IH insert.hyps(1)
      by metis+
    moreover have "
          ((Œªs. fmupd x True s) ` {s. fmdom' s = F})
          ‚à© ((Œªs. fmupd x False s) ` {s. fmdom' s = F})
        = {}
      "
      using False insert.hyps(1) updates_disjoint
      by metis
    moreover have "card (
          ((Œªs. fmupd x True s) ` {s. fmdom' s = F})
          ‚à™ ((Œªs. fmupd x False s) ` {s. fmdom' s = F})
        )
        = card (((Œªs. fmupd x True s) ` {s. fmdom' s = F}))
          + card ((Œªs. fmupd x False s) ` {s. fmdom' s = F})
      "
      using calculation card_Un_disjoint card.infinite
        power_eq_0_iff rel_simps(76)
      by metis
    then have "card (
          ((Œªs. fmupd x True s) ` {s. fmdom' s = F})
          ‚à™ ((Œªs. fmupd x False s) ` {s. fmdom' s = F})
        )
        = 2 * (2^(card F))"
      using calculation(1, 2)
      by presburger
    then have "card (
          ((Œªs. fmupd x True s) ` {s. fmdom' s = F})
          ‚à™ ((Œªs. fmupd x False s) ` {s. fmdom' s = F})
        )
        = 2^(card (insert x F))"
      using insert.IH 3
      by metis
    then show ?thesis
      using "2"
      by argo
  qed
qed


subsubsection "State Lists and State Sets"


‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE using fun because of two defining equations.‚Ä∫
‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE paired argument replaced by currying.‚Ä∫
fun state_list where
  "state_list s [] = [s]"
| "state_list s (a # as) = s # state_list (state_succ s a) as"


lemma empty_state_list_lemma:
  fixes as s
  shows "¬¨([] = state_list s as)"
proof (induction as)
qed auto


lemma state_list_length_non_zero:
  fixes as s
  shows "¬¨(0 = length (state_list s as))"
proof (induction as)
qed auto


lemma state_list_length_lemma:
  fixes as s
  shows "length as = length (state_list s as) - 1"
proof (induction as arbitrary: s)
next case (Cons a as)
  have "length (state_list s (Cons a as)) - 1 =  length (state_list (state_succ s a) as)"
    by auto
      ‚Äï ‚ÄπTODO unwrap metis proof.‚Ä∫
  then show "length (Cons a as) = length (state_list s (Cons a as)) - 1"
    by (metis Cons.IH Suc_diff_1 empty_state_list_lemma length_Cons length_greater_0_conv)
qed simp


lemma state_list_length_lemma_2:
  fixes as s
  shows "(length (state_list s as)) = (length as + 1)"
proof (induction as arbitrary: s)
qed auto


‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE using fun because of multiple defining equations.‚Ä∫
‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE name shortened to 'state\_def'‚Ä∫
fun state_set where
  "state_set [] = {}"
| "state_set (s # ss) = insert [s] (Cons s ` (state_set ss))"


lemma state_set_thm:
  fixes s1
  shows "s1 ‚àà state_set s2 ‚ü∑ prefix s1 s2 ‚àß s1 ‚â† []"
proof -
  ‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE Show equivalence by proving both directions. Left-to-right is trivial. Right-to-Left
  primarily involves exploiting the prefix premise, induction hypothesis  and  `state\_set`
  definition.‚Ä∫
  have "s1 ‚àà state_set s2 ‚üπ prefix s1 s2 ‚àß s1 ‚â† []"
    by (induction s2 arbitrary: s1) auto
  moreover {
    assume P: "prefix s1 s2" "s1 ‚â† []"
    then have "s1 ‚àà state_set s2"
    proof (induction s2 arbitrary: s1)
      case (Cons a s2)
      obtain s1' where 1: "s1 = a # s1'" "prefix s1' s2"
        using Cons.prems(1, 2) prefix_Cons
        by metis
      then show ?case proof (cases "s1' = []")
        case True
        then show ?thesis
          using 1
          by force
      next
        case False
        then have "s1' ‚àà state_set s2"
          using 1 False Cons.IH
          by blast
        then show ?thesis
          using 1
          by fastforce
      qed
    qed simp
  }
  ultimately show "s1 ‚àà state_set s2 ‚ü∑ prefix s1 s2 ‚àß s1 ‚â† []"
    by blast
qed


lemma state_set_finite:
  fixes X
  shows "finite (state_set X)"
  by (induction X) auto


lemma LENGTH_state_set:
  fixes X e
  assumes "e ‚àà state_set X"
  shows "length e ‚â§ length X"
  using assms
  by (induction X arbitrary: e) auto


lemma lemma_temp:
  fixes x s as h
  assumes "x ‚àà state_set (state_list s as)"
  shows "length (h # state_list s as) > length x"
  using assms LENGTH_state_set le_imp_less_Suc
  by force


lemma NIL_NOTIN_stateset:
  fixes X
  shows "[] ‚àâ state_set X"
  by (induction X) auto


‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE added lemma.‚Ä∫
lemma state_set_card_i:
  fixes X a
  shows "[a] ‚àâ (Cons a ` state_set X)"
  by (induction X) auto

‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE added lemma.‚Ä∫
lemma state_set_card_ii:
  fixes X a
  shows "card (Cons a ` state_set X) = card (state_set X)"
proof -
  have "inj_on (Cons a) (state_set X)"
    by simp
  then show ?thesis
    using card_image
    by blast
qed

‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE added lemma.‚Ä∫
lemma state_set_card_iii:
  fixes X a
  shows "card (state_set (a # X)) = 1 + card (state_set X)"
proof -
  have "card (state_set (a # X)) = card (insert [a] (Cons a ` state_set X))"
    by auto
      ‚Äï ‚ÄπTODO unwrap this metis step.‚Ä∫
  also have "‚Ä¶ = 1 + card (Cons a ` state_set X)"
    using state_set_card_i
    by (metis Suc_eq_plus1_left card_insert_disjoint finite_imageI state_set_finite)
  also have"‚Ä¶ = 1 + card (state_set X)"
    using state_set_card_ii
    by metis
  finally show "card (state_set (a # X)) = 1 + card (state_set X)"
    by blast
qed

lemma state_set_card:
  fixes X
  shows "card (state_set X) = length X"
proof (induction X)
  case (Cons a X)
  then have "card (state_set (a # X)) = 1 + card (state_set X)"
    using state_set_card_iii
    by fast
  then show ?case
    using Cons
    by fastforce
qed auto


subsubsection "Properties of Domain Changes During Plan Execution"


lemma FDOM_state_succ:
  assumes "fmdom' (snd a) ‚äÜ fmdom' s"
  shows "(fmdom' (state_succ s a) = fmdom' s)"
  unfolding state_succ_def fmap_add_ltr_def
  using assms
  by force


lemma FDOM_state_succ_subset:
  "fmdom' (state_succ s a) ‚äÜ (fmdom' s ‚à™ fmdom' (snd a))"
  unfolding state_succ_def fmap_add_ltr_def
  by simp


‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE definition `qispl\_then` removed (was not being used).‚Ä∫


lemma FDOM_eff_subset_FDOM_valid_states:
  fixes p e s
  assumes "(p, e) ‚àà PROB" "(s ‚àà valid_states PROB)"
  shows "(fmdom' e ‚äÜ fmdom' s)"
proof -
  {
    have "fmdom' e ‚äÜ action_dom p e"
      unfolding action_dom_def
      by blast
    also have "‚Ä¶ ‚äÜ prob_dom PROB"
      unfolding action_dom_def prob_dom_def
      using assms(1)
      by blast
    finally have "fmdom' e ‚äÜ fmdom' s"
      using assms
      by (auto simp: valid_states_def)
  }
  then show "fmdom' e ‚äÜ fmdom' s"
    by simp
qed


lemma FDOM_eff_subset_FDOM_valid_states_pair:
  fixes a s
  assumes "a ‚àà PROB" "s ‚àà valid_states PROB"
  shows "fmdom' (snd a) ‚äÜ fmdom' s"
proof -
  {
    have "fmdom' (snd a) ‚äÜ (Œª(s1, s2). action_dom s1 s2) a"
      unfolding action_dom_def
      using case_prod_beta
      by fastforce
    also have "‚Ä¶ ‚äÜ prob_dom PROB"
      using assms(1) prob_dom_def Sup_upper
      by fast
    finally have "fmdom' (snd a) ‚äÜ fmdom' s"
      using assms(2) valid_states_def
      by fast
  }
  then show ?thesis
    by simp
qed


lemma FDOM_pre_subset_FDOM_valid_states:
  fixes p e s
  assumes "(p, e) ‚àà PROB" "s ‚àà valid_states PROB"
  shows "fmdom' p ‚äÜ fmdom' s"
proof -
  {
    have "fmdom' p ‚äÜ (Œª(s1, s2). action_dom s1 s2) (p, e)"
      using action_dom_def
      by fast
    also have "‚Ä¶ ‚äÜ prob_dom PROB"
      using assms(1)
      by (simp add: Sup_upper pair_imageI prob_dom_def)
    finally have "fmdom' p ‚äÜ fmdom' s"
      using assms(2) valid_states_def
      by fast
  }
  then show ?thesis
    by simp
qed


lemma FDOM_pre_subset_FDOM_valid_states_pair:
  fixes a s
  assumes "a ‚àà PROB" "s ‚àà valid_states PROB"
  shows "fmdom' (fst a) ‚äÜ fmdom' s"
proof -
  {
    have "fmdom' (fst a) ‚äÜ (Œª(s1, s2). action_dom s1 s2) a"
      using action_dom_def
      by force
    also have "‚Ä¶ ‚äÜ prob_dom PROB"
      using assms(1)
      by (simp add: Sup_upper pair_imageI prob_dom_def)
    finally have "fmdom' (fst a) ‚äÜ fmdom' s"
      using assms(2) valid_states_def
      by fast
  }
  then show ?thesis
    by simp
qed


‚Äï ‚ÄπTODO unwrap the simp proof.‚Ä∫
lemma action_dom_subset_valid_states_FDOM:
  fixes p e s
  assumes "(p, e) ‚àà PROB" "s ‚àà valid_states PROB"
  shows "action_dom p e ‚äÜ fmdom' s"
  using assms
  by (simp add: Sup_upper pair_imageI prob_dom_def valid_states_def)


‚Äï ‚ÄπTODO unwrap the metis proof.‚Ä∫
lemma FDOM_eff_subset_prob_dom:
  fixes p e
  assumes "(p, e) ‚àà PROB"
  shows "fmdom' e ‚äÜ prob_dom PROB"
  using assms
  by (metis Sup_upper Un_subset_iff action_dom_def pair_imageI prob_dom_def)


lemma FDOM_eff_subset_prob_dom_pair:
  fixes a
  assumes "a ‚àà PROB"
  shows "fmdom' (snd a) ‚äÜ prob_dom PROB"
  using assms(1) FDOM_eff_subset_prob_dom surjective_pairing
  by metis


‚Äï ‚ÄπTODO unwrap metis proof.‚Ä∫
lemma FDOM_pre_subset_prob_dom:
  fixes p e
  assumes "(p, e) ‚àà PROB"
  shows "fmdom' p ‚äÜ prob_dom PROB"
  using assms
  by (metis (no_types) Sup_upper Un_subset_iff action_dom_def pair_imageI prob_dom_def)


lemma FDOM_pre_subset_prob_dom_pair:
  fixes a
  assumes "a ‚àà PROB"
  shows "fmdom' (fst a) ‚äÜ prob_dom PROB"
  using assms FDOM_pre_subset_prob_dom surjective_pairing
  by metis


subsubsection "Properties of Valid Plans"


lemma valid_plan_valid_head:
  assumes "(h # as ‚àà valid_plans PROB)"
  shows  "h ‚àà PROB"
  using assms valid_plans_def
  by force


lemma valid_plan_valid_tail:
  assumes "(h # as ‚àà valid_plans PROB)"
  shows "(as ‚àà valid_plans PROB)"
  using assms
  by (simp add: valid_plans_def)


‚Äï ‚ÄπTODO unwrap simp proof.‚Ä∫
lemma valid_plan_pre_subset_prob_dom_pair:
  assumes "as ‚àà valid_plans PROB"
  shows "(‚àÄa. ListMem a as ‚ü∂ fmdom' (fst a) ‚äÜ (prob_dom PROB))"
  unfolding valid_plans_def
  using assms
  by (simp add: FDOM_pre_subset_prob_dom_pair ListMem_iff rev_subsetD valid_plans_def)


lemma valid_append_valid_suff:
  assumes "as1 @ as2 ‚àà (valid_plans PROB)"
  shows "as2 ‚àà (valid_plans PROB)"
  using assms
  by (simp add: valid_plans_def)


lemma valid_append_valid_pref:
  assumes "as1 @ as2 ‚àà (valid_plans PROB)"
  shows "as1 ‚àà (valid_plans PROB)"
  using assms
  by (simp add: valid_plans_def)


lemma valid_pref_suff_valid_append:
  assumes "as1 ‚àà (valid_plans PROB)" "as2 ‚àà (valid_plans PROB)"
  shows "(as1 @ as2) ‚àà (valid_plans PROB)"
  using assms
  by (simp add: valid_plans_def)


‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE showcase (case split seems necessary for MP of IH but the original proof does not need it).‚Ä∫
lemma MEM_statelist_FDOM:
  fixes PROB h as s0
  assumes "s0 ‚àà (valid_states PROB)" "as ‚àà (valid_plans PROB)" "ListMem h (state_list s0 as)"
  shows "(fmdom' h = fmdom' s0)"
  using assms
proof (induction as arbitrary: PROB h s0)
  case Nil
  have "h = s0"
    using Nil.prems(3) ListMem_iff
    by force
  then show ?case
    by simp
next
  case (Cons a as)
  then show ?case
    ‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE This case split seems necessary to be able to infer

          'ListMem h (state\_list (state\_succ s0 a) as)'

        which is required in order to apply MP to the induction hypothesis.‚Ä∫
  proof (cases "h = s0")
    case False
      ‚Äï ‚ÄπTODO proof steps could be refactored into auxillary lemmas.‚Ä∫
    {
      have "a ‚àà PROB"
        using Cons.prems(2) valid_plan_valid_head
        by fast
      then have "fmdom' (snd a) ‚äÜ fmdom' s0"
        using Cons.prems(1) FDOM_eff_subset_FDOM_valid_states_pair
        by blast
      then have "fmdom' (state_succ s0 a) = fmdom' s0"
        using FDOM_state_succ[of _ s0] Cons.prems(1) valid_states_def
        by presburger
    }
    note 1 = this
    {
      have "fmdom' s0 = prob_dom PROB"
        using Cons.prems(1) valid_states_def
        by fast
      then have "state_succ s0 a ‚àà valid_states PROB"
        unfolding valid_states_def
        using 1
        by force
    }
    note 2 = this
    {
      have "ListMem h (state_list (state_succ s0 a) as)"
        using Cons.prems(3) False
        by (simp add: ListMem_iff)
    }
    note 3 = this
    {
      have "as ‚àà valid_plans PROB"
        using Cons.prems(2) valid_plan_valid_tail
        by fast
      then have "fmdom' h = fmdom' (state_succ s0 a)"
        using 1 2 3 Cons.IH[of "state_succ s0 a"]
        by blast
    }
    then show ?thesis
      using 1
      by argo
  qed simp
qed


‚Äï ‚ÄπTODO unwrap metis proof.‚Ä∫
lemma MEM_statelist_valid_state:
  fixes PROB h as s0
  assumes "s0 ‚àà valid_states PROB" "as ‚àà valid_plans PROB" "ListMem h (state_list s0 as)"
  shows "(h ‚àà valid_states PROB)"
  using assms
  by (metis MEM_statelist_FDOM mem_Collect_eq valid_states_def)


‚Äï ‚ÄπTODO refactor (characterization lemma for 'state\_succ').‚Ä∫
‚Äï ‚ÄπTODO unwrap metis proof.‚Ä∫
‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE added lemma.‚Ä∫
lemma lemma_1_i:
  fixes s a PROB
  assumes "s ‚àà valid_states PROB" "a ‚àà PROB"
  shows "state_succ s a ‚àà valid_states PROB"
  using assms
  by (metis FDOM_eff_subset_FDOM_valid_states_pair FDOM_state_succ mem_Collect_eq  valid_states_def)

‚Äï ‚ÄπTODO unwrap smt proof.‚Ä∫
‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE added lemma.‚Ä∫
lemma lemma_1_ii:
  "last ` ((#) s ` state_set (state_list (state_succ s a) as))
  = last ` state_set (state_list (state_succ s a) as)"
  by (smt NIL_NOTIN_stateset image_cong image_image last_ConsR)

lemma lemma_1:
  fixes as :: "(('a, 'b) fmap √ó ('a, 'b) fmap) list" and PPROB
  assumes "(s ‚àà valid_states PROB)" "(as ‚àà valid_plans PROB)"
  shows "((last ` (state_set (state_list s as))) ‚äÜ valid_states PROB)"
  using assms
proof (induction as arbitrary: s PROB)
  ‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE Base case simplifies to @{term "{s} ‚äÜ valid_states PROB"} which itself follows directly from
    1st assumption.‚Ä∫
  case (Cons a as)
  text ‚Äπ Split the 'insert' term produced by @{term "state_set (state_list s (a # as))"} and proof
      inclusion in 'valid\_states PROB' for both parts. ‚Ä∫
  {
    ‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE Inclusion of the first subset follows from the induction premise by simplification.
      The inclusion of the second subset is shown by applying the induction hypothesis to
      `state\_succ s a` and some elementary set simplifications.‚Ä∫
    have "last [s] ‚àà valid_states PROB"
      using Cons.prems(1)
      by simp
    moreover {
      {
        have "a ‚àà PROB"
          using Cons.prems(2) valid_plan_valid_head
          by fast
        then have "state_succ s a ‚àà valid_states PROB"
          using Cons.prems(1) lemma_1_i
          by blast
      }
      moreover have "as ‚àà valid_plans PROB"
        using Cons.prems(2) valid_plan_valid_tail
        by fast
      then have "(last ` state_set (state_list (state_succ s a) as)) ‚äÜ valid_states PROB"
        using  calculation Cons.IH[of "state_succ s a"]
        by presburger
      then have "(last ` ((#) s ` state_set (state_list (state_succ s a) as))) ‚äÜ valid_states PROB"
        using lemma_1_ii
        by metis
    }
    ultimately have
      "(last ` insert [s] ((#) s ` state_set (state_list (state_succ s a) as))) ‚äÜ valid_states PROB"
      by simp
  }
  then show ?case
    by fastforce
qed auto


‚Äï ‚ÄπTODO unwrap metis proof.‚Ä∫
lemma len_in_state_set_le_max_len:
  fixes as x PROB
  assumes "(s ‚àà valid_states PROB)" "(as ‚àà valid_plans PROB)" "¬¨(as = [])"
    "(x ‚àà state_set (state_list s as))"
  shows "(length x ‚â§ (Suc (length as)))"
  using assms
  by (metis LENGTH_state_set Suc_eq_plus1_left add.commute state_list_length_lemma_2)


lemma card_state_set_cons:
  fixes as s h
  shows "
    (card (state_set (state_list s (h # as)))
    = Suc (card (state_set (state_list (state_succ s h) as))))
  "
  by (metis length_Cons state_list.simps(2) state_set_card)


lemma card_state_set:
  fixes as s
  shows "(Suc (length as)) = card (state_set (state_list s as))"
  by (simp add: state_list_length_lemma_2 state_set_card)


lemma neq_mems_state_set_neq_len:
  fixes as x y s
  assumes "x ‚àà state_set (state_list s as)" "(y ‚àà state_set (state_list s as))" "¬¨(x = y)"
  shows "¬¨(length x = length y)"
proof -
  have "x ‚â† []" "prefix x (state_list s as)"
    using assms(1) state_set_thm
    by blast+
  moreover have "y ‚â† []" "prefix y (state_list s as)"
    using assms(2) state_set_thm
    by blast+
  ultimately show ?thesis
    using assms(3) append_eq_append_conv prefixE
    by metis
qed


‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE added definition (imported from pred\_setScript.sml:1562).‚Ä∫
definition inj :: "('a ‚áí 'b) ‚áí 'a set ‚áí 'b set ‚áí bool" where
  "inj f A B ‚â° (‚àÄx ‚àà A. f x ‚àà B) ‚àß inj_on f A"


‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE added lemma; refactored from `not\_eq\_last\_diff\_paths`.‚Ä∫
lemma not_eq_last_diff_paths_i:
  fixes s as PROB
  assumes "s ‚àà valid_states PROB" "as ‚àà valid_plans PROB" "x ‚àà state_set (state_list s as)"
  shows "last x ‚àà valid_states PROB"
proof -
  have "last x ‚àà last ` (state_set (state_list s as))"
    using assms(3)
    by simp
  then show ?thesis
    using assms(1, 2) lemma_1
    by blast
qed

lemma not_eq_last_diff_paths_ii:
  assumes "(s ‚àà valid_states PROB)" "(as ‚àà valid_plans PROB)"
    "¬¨(inj (last) (state_set (state_list s as)) (valid_states PROB))"
  shows "‚àÉl1. ‚àÉl2.
    l1 ‚àà state_set (state_list s as)
    ‚àß l2 ‚àà state_set (state_list s as)
    ‚àß last l1 = last l2
    ‚àß l1 ‚â† l2
  "
proof -
  let ?S="state_set (state_list s as)"
  have 1: "¬¨(‚àÄx‚àà?S. last x ‚àà valid_states PROB) = False"
    using assms(1, 2) not_eq_last_diff_paths_i
    by blast
  {
    have
      "(¬¨(inj (last) ?S (valid_states PROB))) = (¬¨((‚àÄx‚àà?S. ‚àÄy‚àà?S. last x = last y ‚ü∂ x = y)))"
      unfolding inj_def inj_on_def
      using 1
      by blast
    then have "
        (¬¨(inj (last) ?S (valid_states PROB)))
        = (‚àÉx. ‚àÉy. x‚àà?S ‚àß y‚àà?S ‚àß last x = last y ‚àß x ‚â† y)
      "
      using assms(3)
      by blast
  }
  then show ?thesis
    using assms(3) by blast
qed

lemma not_eq_last_diff_paths:
  fixes as PROB s
  assumes "(s ‚àà valid_states PROB)" "(as ‚àà valid_plans PROB)"
    "¬¨(inj (last) (state_set (state_list s as)) (valid_states PROB))"
  shows "(‚àÉslist_1 slist_2.
    (slist_1 ‚àà state_set (state_list s as))
    ‚àß (slist_2 ‚àà state_set (state_list s as))
    ‚àß ((last slist_1) = (last slist_2))
    ‚àß ¬¨(length slist_1 = length slist_2))
  "
proof -
  obtain l1 l2 where "
      l1 ‚àà state_set (state_list s as)
      ‚àß l2 ‚àà state_set (state_list s as)
      ‚àß last l1 = last l2
      ‚àß l1 ‚â† l2
    "
    using assms(1, 2, 3) not_eq_last_diff_paths_ii
    by blast
  then show ?thesis
    using neq_mems_state_set_neq_len
    by blast
qed


‚Äï ‚ÄπNOTE this lemma was removed due to being redundant and being shadowed later on:

  lemma empty\_list\_nin\_state\_set‚Ä∫


lemma nempty_sl_in_state_set:
  fixes sl
  assumes "sl ‚â† []"
  shows "sl ‚àà state_set sl"
  using assms state_set_thm
  by auto


lemma empty_list_nin_state_set:
  fixes h slist as
  assumes "(h # slist) ‚àà state_set (state_list s as)"
  shows "(h = s)"
  using assms
  by (induction as) auto


lemma cons_in_state_set_2:
  fixes s slist h t
  assumes "(slist ‚â† [])" "((s # slist) ‚àà state_set (state_list s (h # t)))"
  shows "(slist ‚àà state_set (state_list (state_succ s h) t))"
  using assms
  by (induction slist) auto


‚Äï ‚ÄπTODO move up and replace 'FactoredSystem.lemma\_1\_i'?‚Ä∫
lemma valid_action_valid_succ:
  assumes "h ‚àà PROB" "s ‚àà valid_states PROB"
  shows "(state_succ s h) ‚àà valid_states PROB"
  using assms lemma_1_i
  by blast


lemma in_state_set_imp_eq_exec_prefix:
  fixes slist as PROB s
  assumes "(as ‚â† [])" "(slist ‚â† [])" "(s ‚àà valid_states PROB)" "(as ‚àà valid_plans PROB)"
    "(slist ‚àà state_set (state_list s as))"
  shows
    "(‚àÉas'. (prefix as' as) ‚àß (exec_plan s as' = last slist) ‚àß (length slist = Suc (length as')))"
  using assms
proof (induction slist arbitrary: as s PROB)
  case cons_1: (Cons a slist)
  have 1: "s # slist ‚àà state_set (state_list s as)"
    using cons_1.prems(5) empty_list_nin_state_set
    by auto
  then show ?case
    using cons_1
  proof (cases as)
    case cons_2: (Cons a' R‚á©a‚á©s)
    then have a: "state_succ s a' ‚àà valid_states PROB"
      using cons_1.prems(3, 4) valid_action_valid_succ valid_plan_valid_head
      by metis
    then have b: "R‚á©a‚á©s ‚àà valid_plans PROB"
      using cons_1.prems(4) cons_2 valid_plan_valid_tail
      by fast
    then show ?thesis
    proof (cases slist)
      case Nil
      then show ?thesis
        using cons_1.prems(5) empty_list_nin_state_set
        by auto
    next
      case cons_3: (Cons a'' R‚á©s‚á©l‚á©i‚á©s‚á©t)
      then have i: "a'' # R‚á©s‚á©l‚á©i‚á©s‚á©t ‚àà state_set (state_list (state_succ s a') R‚á©a‚á©s)"
        using 1 cons_2 cons_in_state_set_2
        by blast
      then show ?thesis
      proof (cases R‚á©a‚á©s)
        case Nil
        then show ?thesis
          using i cons_2 cons_3
          by auto
      next
        case (Cons a''' R‚á©a‚á©s')
        then obtain as' where
          "prefix as' (a''' # R‚á©a‚á©s')" "exec_plan (state_succ s a') as' = last slist"
          "length slist = Suc (length as')"
          using cons_1.IH[of "a''' # R‚á©a‚á©s'" "state_succ s a'" PROB]
          using i a b cons_3
          by blast
        then show ?thesis
          using Cons_prefix_Cons cons_2 cons_3 exec_plan.simps(2) last.simps length_Cons
            list.distinct(1) local.Cons
          by metis
      qed
    qed
  qed auto
qed auto


lemma eq_last_state_imp_append_nempty_as:
  fixes as PROB slist_1 slist_2
  assumes "(as ‚â† [])" "(s ‚àà valid_states PROB)" "(as ‚àà valid_plans PROB)" "(slist_1 ‚â† [])"
    "(slist_2 ‚â† [])" "(slist_1 ‚àà state_set (state_list s as))"
    "(slist_2 ‚àà state_set (state_list s as))" "¬¨(length slist_1 = length slist_2)"
    "(last slist_1 = last slist_2)"
  shows "(‚àÉas1 as2 as3.
    (as1 @ as2 @ as3 = as)
    ‚àß (exec_plan s (as1 @ as2) = exec_plan s as1)
    ‚àß  ¬¨(as2 = [])
  )"
proof -
  obtain as_1 where 1: "(prefix as_1 as)" "(exec_plan s as_1 = last slist_1)"
    "length slist_1 = Suc (length as_1)"
    using assms(1, 2, 3, 4, 6) in_state_set_imp_eq_exec_prefix
    by blast
  obtain as_2 where 2: "(prefix as_2 as)" "(exec_plan s as_2 = last slist_2)"
    "(length slist_2) = Suc (length as_2)"
    using assms(1, 2, 3, 5, 7) in_state_set_imp_eq_exec_prefix
    by blast
  then have "length as_1 ‚â† length as_2"
    using assms(8) 1(3) 2(3)
    by fastforce
  then consider (i) "length as_1 < length as_2" | (ii) "length as_1 > length as_2"
    by force
  then show ?thesis
  proof (cases)
    case i
    then have "prefix as_1 as_2"
      using 1(1) 2(1) len_gt_pref_is_pref
      by blast
    then obtain a where a1: "as_2 = as_1 @ a"
      using prefixE
      by blast
    then obtain b where b1: "as = as_2 @ b"
      using prefixE 2(1)
      by blast
    let ?as1="as_1"
    let ?as2="a"
    let ?as3="b"
    have "as = ?as1 @ ?as2 @ ?as3"
      using a1 b1
      by simp
    moreover have "exec_plan s (?as1 @ ?as2) = exec_plan s ?as1"
      using 1(2) 2(2) a1 assms(9)
      by auto
    moreover have "?as2 ‚â† []"
      using i a1
      by simp
    ultimately show ?thesis
      by blast
  next
    case ii
    then have "prefix as_2 as_1"
      using 1(1) 2(1) len_gt_pref_is_pref
      by blast
    then obtain a where a2: "as_1 = as_2 @ a"
      using prefixE
      by blast
    then obtain b where b2: "as = as_1 @ b"
      using prefixE 1(1)
      by blast
    let ?as1="as_2"
    let ?as2="a"
    let ?as3="b"
    have "as = ?as1 @ ?as2 @ ?as3"
      using a2 b2
      by simp
    moreover have "exec_plan s (?as1 @ ?as2) = exec_plan s ?as1"
      using 1(2) 2(2) a2 assms(9)
      by auto
    moreover have "?as2 ‚â† []"
      using ii a2
      by simp
    ultimately show ?thesis
      by blast
  qed
qed


lemma FINITE_prob_dom:
  assumes "finite PROB"
  shows  "finite (prob_dom PROB)"
proof -
  {
    fix x
    assume P2: "x ‚àà PROB"
    then have 1: "(Œª(s1, s2). action_dom s1 s2) x = fmdom' (fst x) ‚à™ fmdom' (snd x)"
      by (simp add: action_dom_def case_prod_beta')
    then have 2: "finite (fset (fmdom (fst x)))" "finite (fset (fmdom (snd x)))"
      by auto
    then have 3: "fset (fmdom (fst x)) = fmdom' (fst x)" "fset (fmdom (snd x)) = fmdom' (snd x)"
      by (auto simp add: fmdom'_alt_def)
    then have "finite (fmdom' (fst x))"
      using 2 by auto
    then have "finite (fmdom' (snd x))"
      using 2 3 by auto
    then have "finite ((Œª(s1, s2). action_dom s1 s2) x)"
      using 1 2 3
      by simp
  }
  then show "finite (prob_dom PROB)"
    unfolding prob_dom_def
    using assms
    by blast
qed


lemma CARD_valid_states:
  assumes "finite (PROB :: 'a problem)"
  shows "(card (valid_states PROB :: 'a state set) = 2 ^ card (prob_dom PROB))"
proof -
  have 1: "finite (prob_dom PROB)"
